ascii_diagrams.preview:
A[Start] --> B{Decision}
    B -->|Yes| C[Process 1]
    B -->|No| D[Process 2]
    C --> E[End]
    D --> E

Client->>API: Request data
    API->>Database: Query
    Database-->>API: Results
    API-->>Client: Response

A[Load Balancer] --> B[API Server 1]
    A --> C[API Server 2]
    B --> D[(Database)]
    C --> D
    B --> E[Cache]
...

[*] --> Idle
    Idle --> Processing: Start
    Processing --> Success: Complete
    Processing --> Failed: Error
    Success --> [*]
...

| Syntax | Visual | Meaning |
|--------|--------|---------|
| `-->` | Solid arrow | Direct dependency, data flow |
| `-.->` | Dashed arrow | Async/indirect, replication |
| `==>` | Thick arrow | Primary/critical path |
...

- `new(file_path: String) -> Self` - Constructor
- `get_domain() -> Option<String>` - Extract domain from term-id/source-domain/namespace
- `get_full_iri() -> Option<String>` - Resolve namespace:class to full IRI
- `validate() -> Vec<String>` - Tier 1 validation, returns error list

- `run_sssp(source_idx: usize) -> Result<Vec<f32>, String>`
- `get_num_nodes() -> usize`
- `get_node_positions() -> Result<(Vec<f32>, Vec<f32>, Vec<f32>), String>`

- Al-Jarrah et al. (2022), "MetaOntology: Toward developing an ontology for the metaverse," *Frontiers in Big Data*, which proposes a domain ontology framework and discusses evaluation metrics for ontology quality[1].
  - Smith et al. (2025), "Metaverse technology tree: a holistic view," *Frontiers in Artificial Intelligence*, outlining the technological branches underpinning the metaverse, including ontology as a critical component[3].
  - Johnson & Patel (2025), "Metaverse Science, Society and Law," *SciFormat Publishing*, addressing ontological challenges related to digital subjectivity and legal interoperability[2].

- ARCHITECTURE_OVERVIEW.md <-> TECHNOLOGY_CHOICES.md
- ARCHITECTURE_OVERVIEW.md <-> OVERVIEW.md
- ARCHITECTURE_OVERVIEW.md <-> README.md
- DEVELOPER_JOURNEY.md <-> README.md
- OVERVIEW.md <-> README.md
...

C->>S: WebSocket Handshake (with JWT token)
    S->>C: Connection Established (JSON)
    S->>C: State Sync (JSON with metadata counts)
    S->>C: InitialGraphLoad (JSON: ~200 nodes + edges)
    S->>C: Binary Position Data (V2: sparse initial load)

C->>S: subscribe_position_updates (JSON)
        S->>C: subscription_confirmed (JSON)
        S-->>C: Binary Position Updates (V2, throttled)

C->>S: filter_update (JSON: quality threshold)
    S->>C: filter_update_success (JSON)
    S->>C: Filtered Graph (V2 binary)
